parsed.internal_thinking: I have already secured a strong starting position at Node 20, which provides Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8). For my second settlement, my primary goal is to secure a reliable source of Wheat and Ore, as these are essential for building cities and buying development cards later in the game. Looking at the remaining open nodes, Node 43 was my top choice for Wheat, but it is blocked by Bob's settlement at Node 42. Node 44 is the best available alternative, offering two high-probability Wheat tiles (Wh9 and Wh6) and an Ore source (O2). This gives me a total of 10 pips on this node and ensures I have production for all five resources from the start. While Node 18 offers more total pips (12), it lacks Wheat entirely, which would make my early game much more difficult. By choosing Node 44, I'll receive a starting hand of two Wheat and one Ore, providing a balanced foundation for expansion. My plan is to then build a road toward Node 45 to keep my expansion options open along the southern coast.
parsed.note_to_self: Second settlement placed at Node 44 (Wh9, Wh6, O2). This completes my resource diversity. Next steps: 1) Expand from Node 10 to Node 9 to secure the 3:1 port. 2) Look to upgrade Node 20 or 44 to a city as soon as Ore and Wheat allow. 3) Monitor Bob's expansion near the center, as he has a strong Wheat/Ore base at 42.
parsed.say_outloud: That's a nice setup, Bob and Charlie! I'm going to take Node 44 to round out my resources with some much-needed Wheat and Ore. It looks like we're all going to have some decent production to start the game. Good luck to everyone on the first few rolls!
